additionalGoals.name: Website Migration
additionalGoals.raw:
# üåê Website Migration ‚Äî Strikingly ‚Üí GitHub Pages

## Status: TODO (noted Feb 10, 2026)

## Objective
Move all personal websites from Strikingly to GitHub Pages (or similar static hosting). Same approach as everclaw.xyz ‚Äî static sites, GitHub repos, custom domains.

## Websites to Migrate
1. www.basedai.co
2. www.austinagentweek.com
3. www.promptrank.org
4. www.myai.foundation
5. www.settlers.space
6. www.davidajohnston.me
7. www.smartcontractrank.org
8. www.smartagent.org
9. www.freeaiday.org
10. www.agentrank.org
11. www.mor.builders
12. www.savannahstuff.me
13. www.decentralizeai.org
14. www.freemansjourney.com
15. www.ethagent.org
16. www.polygonagent.org
17. www.smartagency.ai
18. www.johnstonslaw.org
19. www.voluntarist.co
20. www.journeytofreedom.me
21. NetworkNation.org

## Design Tool
- Consider Loveable (lovable.dev) ‚Äî AI-powered website builder
- Could generate React/static sites that deploy to GitHub Pages
- Need to evaluate vs hand-coded static sites vs other tools

## Approach
- Scrape existing Strikingly sites for content/structure
- Rebuild as static sites (HTML/CSS or React via Loveable)
- Host on GitHub Pages with custom domains
- Migrate DNS records one at a time

## Priority
- Not urgent ‚Äî future project after Everclaw stabilizes
- basedai.co and davidajohnston.me likely highest priority

keyFacts.heading: Everclaw Skill (profbernardoj/everclaw)
keyFacts.content:
### Current Version: v0.9.8.3 (community contributions)
- Merged 7 PRs from Scott Berenzweig (betterbrand): dynamic model discovery, install.sh v5.11.0 fix, bash 3.2 compat, agent integration docs, DIY guide link, viem dependency, staking economics fix
- OpenClaw skill for decentralized AI inference via Morpheus network
- Website: everclaw.xyz (GitHub Pages from docs/)
- Repo: profbernardoj/everclaw on GitHub
### Architecture
- **Morpheus proxy:** `~/morpheus/proxy/morpheus-proxy.mjs` (port 8083

keyFacts.heading: David's Model Preferences
keyFacts.content:
- **DO NOT use:** llama-3.3-70b, deepseek-v3.2 as backup models
- **Open-source first:** Morpheus models handle everything possible, Claude only as fallback
- GLM-5: default for most work (free via Morpheus, Opus 4.5 level quality)
- GLM 4.7 Flash: trivial tasks (free, fast)
- Claude 4.6: fallback only when GLM-5 can't complete the task (expensive)
- Cron jobs should migrate from `morpheus/kimi-k2.5` to `morpheus/glm-5`
- MiniMax-M2.5: available on mor-gateway and Venice but has latency issues (

keyFacts.heading: Lessons Learned
keyFacts.content:
### Morpheus models need reasoning: false in OpenClaw config (2026-02-11)
All Morpheus provider models (kimi-k2.5, kimi-k2-thinking, glm-4.7-flash) must have `"reasoning": false` in openclaw.json. The upstream litellm rejects the `reasoning_effort` parameter ‚Äî if set to true, cron jobs using Morpheus models fail with HTTP 400. Fixed via config.patch.
### Morpheus Proxy Error Classification (2026-02-11)
Morpheus infrastructure failures (502s) must return `type: "server_error"` not `"billing"` ‚Äî o

keyFacts.content:
- Org: https://github.com/orgs/SmartAgentProtocol
- Role: admin/owner (profbernardoj)
- **Repo:** https://github.com/SmartAgentProtocol/smartagent (live as of Feb 12)
- **Website:** https://smartagent.org (live, GitHub Pages, HTTPS)
- **DNS:** Direct A records at sav.com registrar (Cloudflare account exists as backup)
- **Vision:** OpenClaw + Everclaw + sensible defaults, packaged for non-technical users
- **Architecture:** Installer-first (not fork). `curl install.sh | bash` ‚Üí free inference im

keyFacts.heading: Key People & Thinkers
keyFacts.content:
- **Balaji Srinivasan** (@balajis) ‚Äî Network School founder, *The Network State* author
  - Network State = voluntary smart contract governance (opt-in, replaces nation-state force model)
  - 10 durable skills in AI age: vision, verification, prompting, polishing, community, geography, scarcity, cryptography, physicality, resiliency
  - Relevant to: Abolition of State goal + Family education framework
  - Full quote saved: `memory/insights/balaji-value-in-age-of-ai.md`

keyFacts.heading: Language & Messaging (2026-02-12)
keyFacts.content:
- **NEVER say "free inference"** ‚Äî David directive: say "own your inference" / "inference you own"
- Morpheus = ownership, not rental. MOR staking = inference forever (tokens staked, returned, recycled)
- Morpheus API Gateway during beta = "community-powered" / "open access" (not "free")
- **Don't highlight Llama 3.3** ‚Äî David considers it outdated. Focus on Kimi K2.5 and GLM-4 models

keyFacts.heading: OpenClaw Update Security Checks (2026-02-15)
keyFacts.content:
**Context:** OpenClaw creator Peter was hired by OpenAI (Feb 2026). OpenAI has a track record of pivoting from open-source mission to closed, for-profit model. Foundation promises notwithstanding, we must verify on EVERY update:
**Fork:** https://github.com/profbernardoj/openclaw ‚Äî preserved pre-OpenAI version as backup
### Mandatory Pre-Update Checks
1. **License verification:** `git log --follow -p -- LICENSE | head -50` ‚Äî confirm MIT license unchanged
2. **No OpenAI defaults:** `grep -ri "ope
